rComments: He's an easy professor but pretty boring in class. He mainly talked the whole time and his feedback on papers wasn't helpful, but easy A. He gave a ton of options for papers and final was super easy to do.

Honestly one of the easiest classes at UCSC, you don't even have to show up even if the class is only 20 people because he doesn't care, just as long as you turn in the 3-4 short essays and let him ramble for an hour.

Class can be a drag, especially in the mornings. It's mostly discussion, he talks through the whole class if no one talks. He's a super easy grader and the essays are easy and you can make up your own prompts all the time. Make sure you bring your books to class, reading aloud and small presentations about chapters are the norm.

James is a really cool guy. He loves it when you go to his office hours. Class can be tedious, a lot of sitting and listening. The class is supportive and encouraging even if you have a different view from everyone else. There are few assignments compared to other classes and grades easy. Great class if you prefer discussions.

Essays are few and easy; there is never a specific prompt and you can make up your own.  He's chill and willing to accommodate to your needs or issues and he is ALWAYS in his office willing to give advice.  He's anal about grammar, but doesnt necessarily grade on that. he does make you sign in each class and at most plenary. Overall awesome dude

BEST TEACHER EVER!!! I love reading all his helpful comments on papers. He is one of the only teachers who I have heard actually thank his students for their work. He bought a cheesecake and coffee for everyone on our final day of class, how much better can it get?! By far one of the most intelligent, thought provoking instructors I have ever had!

One of the sickest teachers. A little unclear but funny and interesting. Less and shorter essays than any other Core. A really chill hippy teacher. Jump into discussion with him. It will be interesting and he will like you. Always happy to help although his responses are quite broad. Take the class!

Loved this class at first, but was VERY dissatisfied after finals. He never gives due dates on assignment sheets and many "requirements" are verbally assigned. Not surprisingly this causes confusion, and my A- paper, A-/B+ paper, and "very strong" research paper somehow = B+? He was also VERY rude when I politely emailed him to ask what happened.

He is a really relaxed guy. The class is really easy and he gives a lot of good feedback on your essays. Read the books only if you're gonna write about them. It's basically a high school class but you're writing does get better.
cool, laid back teacher. he has a lot of worldly knowledge and encourages his students to go out and explore the world. easy grader, easy assignments. take his core course if you can!

He's an awesome teacher! Really insightful, helpful, informative, and great lecturer. One of the best classes I've taken this quarter. We talked about a lot of social issues in the class ranging from Women's rights, homosexual rights, and homelessness around the world. I highly recommend this class!(revised due to mistakes)

He's an awesome teacher! Really insightful, helpful, informative, and great lecturer. One of the best classes I've taken this quarter. We talked about a lot of social issues in the class ranging from Women's rights, homosexual rights, and homelessness around the world. I highly recommend this class!(revision from my last post cause I made a mistake

He's an awesome teacher! Really insightful, helpful, informative, and great lecturer. One of the best classes I've taken this quarter. We talked about a lot of social issues in the class ranging from Women's rights, homosexual rights, and homelessness around the world. I highly recommend this class! :)
He pretty much let us talk about whatever we wanted, but always had something interesting to interject with. He's really nice, the class is easy, and he has a great clothing style.

Took cowell core 80A. and mr. christianson was a tremendous help. He always left a bunch of comments on everyone's essays giving us each something to work on and to improve our writing skills. I also liked how it was more a discussion class, the group was small, and CHrisitianson was very nice and personable. he was overall helpful and a nice guy.

I love Christianson. He's so interesting and quirky, which I'd take any day over a flat and boring teacher. He brought really cool stuff to class to engage us in the material, like a recording of Ginsberg reading "Howl," and tons of other outside sources. He's really enthusiastic in his replies to papers and is always willing to talk. Way cool!

Probably my favorite class so far. He does tend to mumble, so sometimes he is hard to hear, but overall, he's a wonderful professor. He does like to EDIT/PROOFREAD, and he's warned of this ahead of time, so it's not  surprising to have many comments and grammar sugesstons on a paper, all of which I have found generally helpful.
Really great teacher, very kind and understanding. Flexible with deadlines if you talked to him ahead of time. Very simple: go to class, if you have trouble just talk to him, pretty easy A.

American Studies IS a real field of study, and there is expected material to cover. If I had wanted a lit. analysis course, I would have taken one. I was very dissapointed with his lesson plan (not like he had one). Listening to his political sidetracks got irritating, and his mumble isn't audible in a class of 100. Forget this guy for AMST.

Christianson is really cool. He does mumble and will sometimes write weird comments on your paper (like inserting an "I think" before your thesis, or "Isn't this a TV show on HBO?"), but he gives great feedback at the end of each assignment and is amazing to talk with in or out of class. Pay attention, read, come to class, discuss, have fun!

James is a good guy.  A lot of people hated him because he mumbles, rambles, and supposedly didnt teach the class as many American Studies majors wanted it to be taught (cmon its not a real field of study anyway).  Hes a lit guy, assigns a lot of reading which u dont have to do if u dont want, anyone can get an A regardless of TA if u can write.
No Comments

I gave the easiness a 4 bc ur grade depends on who your TA is, but you can do all the essays without coming to class/doing the reading. He gives 11 essay topics per assignment so you really only have to read a few books.  His lectures are so boring and he mumbles to himself all the time, but really laid back teacher.

sometimes comments on your paper sound like he didnt read the books. will edit your paper according to own specific style-including word choice.its not so much that you learn what you did wrong as you learn how he would have written your paper. nice guy and doesnt like giving bad grades but still pretty annoying to watch him misinterpret your ideas

I agree with 11/23/05 in their description of his voice.  he does drop it down way low.  However, I do not agree that this is a 'man to be taught by' his liberal bias extends beyond mere comic releif.  He is completely unfocused in his teaching, as if he came to class high, and then grades you down if you don't mimic his own wordy style of writing.

This man defines the laid-back Santa Cruz professor. Comically biased, politically, but very open-minded. Sometimes be begins rambling and his voice lowers to a mere mumble you can barely hear--while he's explaining an assignment, no less--but he's a great guy and a joy to be taught by. Think for yourself, state your thoughts, and come to class.

Despite sometimes letting the class get sidetracked into tangents, he's a good discussion facilitator.  Also, the COPIOUS written feedback he gives you on each paper is very helpful and spot-on.  Lovely guy.
Awesome guy, great person to talk to out of class. True Santa Crus resident.

James is great!  He's such a cool guy.  Discussions in his class were always interesting. His essay topics were sometimes difficult, but he always gave such helpful comments and criticism.  He's really intelligent and easy-going.  Definitely one of the best teachers I've ever had
Great teacher, knows his topics well! His essay topics are complicated and long, but you just have to pick out the question.

James is the coolest teacher I have ever had. If you are interested in music and film, and you enjoy creative assignments, this is the guy for you. He also brought coffee and pastries to our class a few times.

james is kind of crazy.  he tells some great stories.  his feedback is impressive (though liberal, but i guess that's expected at this school) and immensely helpful.  he's not big on grades, so regardless of how you do, you're pretty much guaranteed a b+.
